item.title: [POWERGRID] Power Grid Corporation Fined Rs. 5,42,800 Each by BSE and NSE for Non-Compliance with Board Composition Requirement
item.description:
Power Grid Corporation of India Ltd. has received notices from BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited regarding non-compliance with the requirement related to composition of the Board (Regulation 17(1) of SEBI LODR) during the quarter ended 31st December, 2025. Both BSE and NSE have imposed a fine of Rs. 5,42,800 each, including GST, for such non-compliance. The company, being a Government Company, has taken up the matter with the Administrative Ministry i.e. Ministry of Power for filling up the vacant posts of Independent Directors. Power Grid Corporation has requested BSE & NSE to grant waiver of fine w.r.t. non-compliance with the Regulation 17(1) of the SEBI LODR.

  • Power Grid Corporation fined Rs. 5,42,800 each by BSE and NSE
  • Non-compliance with Regulation 17(1) of SEBI LODR
  • Relates to composition of the Board during the quarter ended 31st December, 2025
  • Power Grid Corporation is a Government Company within the meaning of Section 2(45) of the Companies Act, 2013
  • Company has requested BSE & NSE to grant waiver of fine w.r.t. non-compliance with the Regulation 17(1) of the SEBI LODR

item.title: [VASWANI] Vaswani Industries Ltd. Announces Q3 and Nine Months Results for 2025, Revealing Increased Revenue and Profit
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Vaswani Industries Ltd. has announced its un-audited standalone financial results for the third quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The company's revenue from operations has increased by 38.64% for the quarter and 42.35% for the nine months period, compared to the same periods in 2024. The profit before tax and exceptional items has also increased by 65.49% for the quarter and 45.58% for the nine months period. However, the profit for the period has decreased by 795.29 due to exceptional items and tax expense. The company's earnings per equity share (Par value Rs. 10 each) for the quarter are Rs. 0.24 (Basic) and Rs. 0.24 (Diluted). The financial results were reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.

  • Revenue from operations increased by 38.64% for the quarter and 42.35% for the nine months period.
  • Profit before tax and exceptional items increased by 65.49% for the quarter and 45.58% for the nine months period.
  • Profit for the period decreased by 795.29 due to exceptional items and tax expense.
  • Earnings per equity share (Par value Rs. 10 each) for the quarter are Rs. 0.24 (Basic) and Rs. 0.24 (Diluted).
  • Financial results reviewed by the Audit Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.

item.title: [PICTUREHS] Picturehouse Media Ltd: Independent Director, Mr. Gautam Shahi, Resigns
item.description:

The decision was due to a significant increase in Mr. Shahi's professional commitments in his legal practice, making it difficult for him to devote the required time and attention to his role as an Independent Director. item.title: [KESAR] Kesar India Ltd Approves Allotment of 5,74,319 Equity Shares to Non-Promoters
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Kesar India Ltd, in a meeting of the Preferential Issue Committee of the Board of Directors, approved the allotment of 5,74,319 equity shares to non-promoter allottees. The shares are being allotted pursuant to the conversion of 3,74,319 fully convertible warrants allotted on September 18, 2025, at an issue price of Rs. 350 each. The allottees include Gunjan Agarwal, Priyank Dhirendra Shah, Mohit Rajeshkumar Atlani, Mihir Atlani, Yash Suresh Atlani, Prachi Pranav Bhagat, Chintan Viijay Makhecha, Dhavan Govindram Medtiya, and Piyush Narayanlal Medtiya. The paid-up equity share capital of the company will increase to Rs. 28,57,32,290 divided into 2,85,73,229 equity shares of face value of Rs. 10 each.

  • Kesar India Ltd approves allotment of 5,74,319 equity shares to non-promoter allottees.
  • The allotment is pursuant to the conversion of 3,74,319 fully convertible warrants allotted on September 18, 2025.
  • The allottees include Gunjan Agarwal, Priyank Dhirendra Shah, Mohit Rajeshkumar Atlani, Mihir Atlani, Yash Suresh Atlani, Prachi Pranav Bhagat, Chintan Viijay Makhecha, Dhavan Govindram Medtiya, and Piyush Narayanlal Medtiya.
  • The paid-up equity share capital of the company will increase to Rs. 28,57,32,290 divided into 2,85,73,229 equity shares of face value of Rs. 10 each.
  • The meeting of the Preferential Issue Committee of the Board of Directors was commenced at 07:45 P.M. and concluded at 08:00 P.M.
